name: biriyani
recipe: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and herbs, then layer with semi-cooked basmati rice, fried onions, saffron milk, and ghee, cook on low heat (dum) for aromatic, flavorful biryani.

name: Ramen
recipe: Cook instant ramen noodles in boiling water, drain, and toss with a mix of soy sauce, sesame oil, and a sprinkle of chili flakes for a quick and flavorful dish.

name: Mango Shake
recipe: Blend ripe mango chunks, cold milk, a bit of sugar, and ice until smooth, then serve chilled.

name: Vada Pav
recipe: Stuff a spicy mashed potato fritter (batata vada) between a pav (bun) with garlic chutney, green chutney, and fried green chilies, then serve hot.

name: Muffins
recipe: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, eggs, milk, and butter, fold in your favorite add-ins (like blueberries or chocolate chips), and bake until golden.

name: Chicken Tandoori
recipe: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices (like garam masala, cumin, and turmeric), then grill or bake until charred and cooked through.

name: Kachuri
recipe: Fill rolled dough with spiced lentil or pea filling, seal, and deep-fry until golden brown and crispy, then serve hot with tamarind chutney.

name: Pizza
recipe: Spread pizza dough with tomato sauce, add toppings like cheese and vegetables or meat, then bake at 475°F (245°C) until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

name: Chowmin
recipe: Stir-fry boiled noodles with vegetables, soy sauce, and your choice of protein (like chicken or tofu) until golden and slightly crispy.

name: Mojito
recipe: Muddle fresh mint leaves, lime juice, and sugar, add rum, ice, and soda water, then stir and garnish with mint sprigs.

name: Kadai Chicken
recipe: Sauté marinated chicken with onions, bell peppers, and a blend of spices (like coriander, cumin, and garam masala) in a hot kadai (wok) until cooked through and aromatic.

name: Roshmalai
recipe: Soak soft paneer balls (rasgullas) in sweetened, thickened milk flavored with cardamom and saffron, then chill and garnish with nuts before serving.

name: Chili Chicken
recipe: Stir-fry battered chicken pieces with garlic, onions, bell peppers, soy sauce, chili sauce, and spices until crispy and coated in a spicy sauce.

name: Sushi
recipe: Layer sushi rice on nori, add fillings like fish or vegetables, roll tightly, slice, and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

name: Ilish Bhapa
recipe: Cook hilsa fish in a mustard paste with green chilies, turmeric, and mustard oil, then simmer until tender and serve with steamed rice.

name: Chocolate Shake
recipe: Blend milk, chocolate ice cream, and chocolate syrup until smooth, then serve with whipped cream and a cherry on top.

name: Butter Chicken
recipe: Marinate chicken in yogurt, spices, and lemon juice, cook with butter, onions, tomatoes, and cream, then serve with naan or rice.

name: Sondesh
recipe: Prepare fresh chhena (paneer), knead with sugar and cardamom, shape into small pieces, and refrigerate for a delicate Bengali dessert.

name: Misti Pulao
recipe: Cook basmati rice with ghee, aromatic spices, sugar, saffron, and a mix of raisins and nuts for a fragrant and mildly sweet pulao.

name: Sha phaley
recipe: Fill dough with seasoned ground meat and vegetables, shape into half-moons, then deep-fry until golden and crispy.

name: Pan Fried Momo
recipe: Stuff dumpling wrappers with seasoned filling, steam until cooked, then pan-fry until golden and crispy on the outside.

name: Burger
recipe: Grill a seasoned beef patty, layer it on a toasted bun with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and your favorite condiments, then serve hot.

name: Dal Makhani
recipe: Cook soaked black lentils and kidney beans with ginger, garlic, spices, butter, and cream, then simmer slowly for a rich, creamy flavor.

name: Butter Naan
recipe: Knead dough with flour, yogurt, and yeast, roll into discs, cook in a hot tandoor or skillet, then brush with melted butter.

name: Chana Mashala
recipe: Cook boiled chickpeas with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala, then simmer until thick and flavorful.

name: Idli
recipe: Ferment a batter of rice and urad dal, then steam in molds until soft and fluffy.

name: Jalebi
recipe: Prepare a batter with flour and yogurt, pipe into hot oil to form spirals, then soak in sugar syrup for a crispy, sweet treat.

name: Indian Thali
recipe: A vibrant assortment of Indian dishes served on a single platter, including rice, dal, vegetables, roti, pickles, and a sweet treat, offering a complete and balanced meal.

name: Strawberry Icecream
recipe: Blend fresh strawberries with cream, sugar, and vanilla, then churn in an ice cream maker until smooth and creamy.

name: Pao Momo
recipe: Stuff pao (bread rolls) with spicy, seasoned momo filling, steam or pan-fry until cooked through, and serve with chutney.

name: Malai Kofta
recipe: Simmer deep-fried paneer and vegetable balls in a creamy, spiced tomato and onion gravy until well-coated and flavorful.

name: Coconut Laddu
recipe: Combine grated coconut with sweetened condensed milk and cardamom, then shape into balls and chill until firm.

name: Dosa
recipe: Ferment a batter of rice and urad dal, spread thin on a hot griddle, and cook until crisp and golden brown.

name: Samosa
recipe: Fill spiced potato and pea mixture into pastry triangles, then deep-fry until crispy and golden.

name: kaju Katli
recipe: Grind cashews into a fine powder, cook with sugar and ghee until it forms a dough, then roll out and cut into diamond-shaped pieces.

name: Mushroom Pizza
recipe: Top a pizza dough with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and sautéed mushrooms, then bake until crispy and golden.

name: Margharita Pizza
recipe: Top pizza dough with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil leaves, then bake until the crust is crispy and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

name: Rosogolla
recipe: Simmer soft, round paneer balls in a sugary syrup flavored with cardamom until they absorb the sweetness and become spongy.

name: Chole Kulcha
recipe: Serve spicy, simmered chickpea curry (chole) with soft, fluffy kulchas (leavened bread) for a classic North Indian meal.

name: Chili Garlic Noodles
recipe: Stir-fry cooked noodles with garlic, chili paste, soy sauce, and vegetables for a spicy, savory dish.

name: Fish Fry
recipe: Marinate fish fillets in spices and lemon juice, coat with flour or breadcrumbs, then pan-fry until crispy and golden.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
recipe: Top pizza dough with marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and pepperoni slices, then bake until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.

name: Chocolate Mousse
recipe: For a quick chocolate mousse, melt 1 cup of chocolate and mix with 1 cup of whipped cream; chill until set.

name: Wonton Soup
recipe: For a quick wonton soup, bring chicken or vegetable broth to a boil, add store-bought wontons, cook until they float, and garnish with green onions and a splash of soy sauce.

name: Iced Mocha
recipe: Blend brewed coffee, cocoa powder, milk, and ice, then sweeten to taste with sugar or syrup for a refreshing iced mocha.

name: Milk Pudding with Coconut
recipe: Simmer milk with sugar and a thickener like cornstarch, stir until it thickens, then chill until set.

name: Crispy Chicken
recipe: Coat chicken pieces in seasoned flour, dip in beaten egg, then dredge in breadcrumbs, and bake or fry until golden and crispy.

name: Dahi Lassi
recipe: Blend yogurt, water, a pinch of salt, and a touch of sugar until smooth, then garnish with a sprinkle of cumin powder or mint leaves.
